solution_line_template: They need {total_area} square feet / {coverage_per_gallon} square feet/gallon = <<{total_area}/{coverage_per_gallon}={gallons_for_first_coat}>>{gallons_for_first_coat} gallons of paint for their walls.

Since they will do a second coating, then they would need {gallons_for_first_coat} gallons x {num_coats} = <<{gallons_for_first_coat}*{num_coats}={total_gallons_needed}>>{total_gallons_needed} gallons in all.
Eight gallons of paint will cost ${cost_per_gallon}/gallon x {total_gallons_needed} gallons = $<<{cost_per_gallon}*{total_gallons_needed}={total_cost_of_paint}>>{total_cost_of_paint}.

Thus, Jason and Jeremy will each contribute ${total_cost_of_paint}/{num_people_splitting_cost} = $<<{total_cost_of_paint}/{num_people_splitting_cost}={contribution_per_person}>>{contribution_per_person}.
